snippet: A 20-year quest to prove a longstanding hypothesis about how nutrients are transported may come to an end thanks to tiny needles that probe leaves 40 feet up an oak tree.
abstract: Profile of Dr Michael Knoblauch, plant cell biologist at Washington State University who reports being near the end of a 20-year quest to prove a longstanding hypothesis about how nutrients are transported in plants; Knoblauch's research involves painstaking techniques in the open air of Harvard Forest in Massachusetts.
lead_paragraph: A 20-year quest to prove a longstanding hypothesis about how nutrients are transported may come to an end thanks to tiny needles that probe leaves 40 feet up an oak tree.

headline.seo: Biologist Climbs High to Prove Hypothesis About Plants
headline.main: Exploring a Tree One Cell at a Time
headline.print_headline: Exploring a Tree One Cell at a Time
